docs.snippet: Pittsburgh Steelers running back Isaac Redman will start Sunday’s season opener against Tennessee....

docs.snippet: The N.F.L. players association, hoping to capitalize on its members’ smartphone savvy, is offering players a tool to summon a safe ride home....
docs.lead_paragraph: The N.F.L. players association, hoping to capitalize on its members’ smartphone savvy, is offering players a tool to summon a safe ride home.
docs.abstract: National Football League players association announces partnership with technology firm Uber, maker of smartphone app that digitally hail taxis, in effort to reduce problem of players driving under the influence; GPS-based service, available in more than half of the NFL's cities, will allow players and their families to hail a ride within minutes.

headline.main: App for N.F.L. Players to Promote Safe Rides
headline.print_headline: App for N.F.L. Players To Promote Safe Rides

docs.snippet: Three former college football players are suing the NCAA, saying it failed to educate them about the risks of concussions and did not do enough to prevent, diagnose and treat brain injuries....

docs.snippet: Video coordinators must navigate the rules for exchanging game films that can turn their profession into an alchemy of dogged legwork of a detective and the backslapping of a car salesperson....
docs.lead_paragraph: Video coordinators must navigate the rules for exchanging game films that can turn their profession into an alchemy of dogged legwork of a detective and the backslapping of a car salesperson.
docs.abstract: College football video coordinators have thankless job of essentially compiling a team's game plan each week based on game footage of opposing teams;  coordinators, responsible for collecting, vetting and organizing video footage,  must resort to sleuthing and ingenuity when opposing teams are uncooperative.

headline.main: Playing Detective in Finding Films of Opponents
headline.print_headline: Playing Detective in Finding Films of Opponents

docs.snippet: The new penalties for targeting in college football resulted in 10 ejections in 75 FBS games during the first weekend of the season, though three of the ejections were overturned by instant replay....
